snippet: The first outbreak of public anger over Iran’s collapsing currency and other economic maladies jolted the heart of Tehran.
abstract: First outbreak of public anger over Iran’s collapsing currency and other economic maladies jolts Tehran; economists and political analysts say anger reflects accumulated impact of harsh Western economic sanctions over Iran’s disputed nuclear program, as well as the government’s inability to manage an increasingly acute economic crisis.

byline.original: By THOMAS ERDBRINK and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink reported from Tehran, and Rick Gladstone from New York. Ramtin Rastin contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: The first outbreak of public anger over Iran’s collapsing currency and other economic maladies jolted the heart of Tehran.

headline.seo: Clashes and Protest Over Iran Currency Plunge Hit Tehran
headline.main: Violence and Protest in Iran as Currency Drops in Value
headline.print_headline: Anger Erupts in Tehran as Currency Plunges
